name: Inside the Wasp Nest: Understanding Insect Societies
description: Many species of insects—such as ants, bees, wasps, and termites—organise themselves into societies, resembling and in some ways surpassing human societies. How do we understand these insect societies? Dive into ant-hills, wasp nests, and beehives by joining us for this talk by ecologist Raghavendra Gadagkar, who will share his research around the Indian paper wasp Ropalidia marginata. Learn about the observational and experimental methods used to study insects, discover contemporary research around these bugs, and judge how much we know of this often-forgotten society!

name: Curating Ecologies: An Exploration of Space and Art
description:
How do we use space while curating exhibitions? How can a spatial layout transform individual artworks to successfully convey large themes around ecology and the environment? Is there anything like an 'unsuitable' space?

In this workshop, join curator Julia Wintner to explore questions around space and curation—from building relationships with artists to understanding the spatial concerns of an exhibition. With guidance from her, you will also get to conceptualise a speculative art display in a space at Science Gallery Bengaluru.
